I think I have just the absurdity you're looking for! Have you considered "Gentlemen Broncos" (2009)? This quirky comedy stars Michael Angarano as a teenage writer who attends a fantasy writers' convention, only to discover his idea has been stolen by an established novelist. With its offbeat humor and cameos from Mike White and Josh Pais, it's a delightful ride.

If you're in the mood for something even more outrageous, I'd recommend "The Hangover Part II" (2011). This raunchy sequel takes the absurdity of the original to new heights, with our heroes Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug getting into all sorts of wacky misadventures in Thailand. With its star-studded cast, including Bradley Cooper and Zach Galifianakis, it's a wild and unpredictable ride.

You'll also enjoy the charming performances by Kristy Swanson and John Ratzenberger.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more romantic and introspective, I think "Hitch" could be an excellent choice. It's a delightful exploration of the creative process and the meeting of two cinematic legends - Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut.
